name: Stock Portfolio
author: David White

sections.description:
This plugin allows you to track the performance of up to 12 positions in percentage terms. In addition to tickers and cost basis, you can also provide a custom URL for each position and a title for the widget. Finally, you can decide to track the month the trade was entered, as we do with our 821 model trade, or to display the cost basis instead.

Although, built to “scratch my own itch”, I hope some of you will find this plug-in useful as well!

Disclaimer

DIY Investor assumes no responsibility or liability for your trading and investment results.

All information provided is based on data whose accuracy is deemed reliable, but is not guaranteed.

In addition, all information is provided for information and educational purposes only and should not be construed as investment advice.
sections.installation: Upload stock_portfolio to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory or activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
sections.faq:
What do I put in the “Alpha Vantage API Key” field?

Go to https://www.alphavantage.co/ to get your free API key.
sections.changelog:
1.2

  • Updated deprecated jQuery event shorthand

1.1

  • Changed provider to Alpha Vantage (https://www.alphavantage.co/)

1.0

  • Initial release

short_description: Keep track of the percentage gain/loss performance of up to 12 stocks in your portfolio
